newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nihon Unisys aims for further software cooperation.
newsitem.headline: Nihon Unisys aims for further software cooperation.

text.p: Nihon Unisys Ltd said on Thursday it would like to cooperate with other companies to strengthen its business amid a global shift towards downsizing in the software sector.

"We will keep working to satisfy our clients (who use mainframe computers), but on the other hand, we need to carry out networking with other companies as we are in the era of downsizing," Nihon Unisys president Junichi Amano told reporters.
Earlier this week, Fujitsu Ltd announced that it, Nihon Unisys, Hitachi Ltd and NEC Corp had agreed to introduce software which will enable a free exchange of data among the machines they make.
The data-exchange software is expected to help promote electronic commerce, and the group aims to make this a worldwide industry standard, Fujitsu said.
Smaller and more efficient software are becoming popular as demand for personal computers exceeds that of mainframe computers in the hardware sector, Amano said.
Nihon Unisys will increase efforts to develop new software by teaming up with other firms, he added.
